translation: I Had a Dream Where You Dreamed of Me.
transcript: 《我梦见你梦见了我》。

translation: The title is quite a mouthful. Or we can make it even twistier, Liu Mengmei had a dream where Du Liniang Dreamed of Liu Mengmei.
transcript: 这个题目有点拗口，或者可以叫柳梦梅梦见了杜丽娘梦见了柳梦梅。

translation: My inspiration of the title comes from an opera I am too familiar with.
transcript: 我之所以想用这样一个题目，是因为这是一出我再熟悉不过的剧目。

translation: As is well known, in The Peony Pavilion by Tang Xianzu, a great writer of the Ming Dynasty, Du Liniang has an unusual dream.
transcript: 明代的大文豪汤显祖先生写的《牡丹亭》当中，杜丽娘做了一个非同寻常的梦，大家都知道。

translation: However, I insist that the dream does not only belong to her.
transcript: 但是，我却很固执地认为这不仅仅是属于杜丽娘的梦。

translation: During the past twenty years of opera training, every time I played in it, Liu Mengmei was the first character to appear on stage, saying that he had a dream where a girl told him they were meant to be together.
transcript: 学这个戏二十多年，诶，我每次上台的时候其实是柳梦梅先上场， 他说我做了一个梦，我梦见一个女孩子在梦里面跟我说，我们有姻缘之分。

translation: It was not untill the tenth act did Du Liniang come out.
transcript: 戏演到第十出的时候杜丽娘才出来。

translation: She also had a dream in which Liu Mengmei told her they were destined for each other.
transcript: 做了一个梦，柳梦梅出现在她的梦当中说我们两个有姻缘之分。

translation: I myself found this quite fascinating.
transcript: 啧我觉得非常非常地有趣。

translation: Liu Mengmei dreams Du Liniang dreams of him.
transcript: 其实是柳梦梅梦见杜丽娘梦见了柳梦梅。

translation: They actually wander into each other's dream.
transcript: 两个人相互进入到各自的梦当中去。

translation: Their dreams are so intertwined and romantic that make me wonder how complicated a dream could be.
transcript: 但是这个梦如此的纠缠不清，如此的浪漫，啧哎呀我想，梦居然具有这么广阔的空间。

translation: It is not the dream itself that matters, though.
transcript: 但是其实重要的不仅仅是梦本身。

translation: If Du Liniang does not pursue the dream, even regardless of her life,  there would not be such a touching story in which for love the living can die and the dead can be revived.
transcript: 在有这个梦以后，杜丽娘决定要去寻梦，甚至可以放下她的生命去寻梦，才有了这样一个生者可以死，死者可以生的，一个《牡丹亭》的伟大的爱情故事。

translation: So I believe, what really matters is whether you pursue your dream.
transcript: 所以我觉得，梦之后最重要的，是你对这个梦的自我的选择是什么。

translation: As a masterpiece, Peony Pavilion has not only given Du a dream and offered us space to perform, but also taught us an attitude towards life.
transcript: 后来我也发现，《牡丹亭》这样伟大的巨著，四百多年来到今天，不仅仅给了杜丽娘一个梦，给了我们一个表演的空间，更给了我们一种人生的态度。

translation: From my perspective, what matters most is not what I have dreamed of, but what I would do if I had a dream.
transcript: 对于我的梦来讲，最重要的不是我梦见什么，而是对于这样的梦我的选择是什么。

translation: I started to learn opera since I was little.
transcript: 从很小的时候开始。

translation: I spent eight years laying groundwork for my dream, and that made all my performance on the stage.
transcript: 呃，我差不多用了八年的时间，坐科八年，来铸就一个我做梦的一个基础，那就是，我所有演戏的那一些舞台上的唱面坐打翻，舞台上的点点滴滴 。

translation: By the way, would you like to see the pictures of our performance in The Peony Pavilion?
transcript: 诶，可以给大家看看我们《牡丹亭》的漂亮的照片吗？

translation: The love story is very much romantic, but the operatic training is not.
transcript: 牡丹亭是一个非常非常浪漫的，嗯，爱情故事，嗯，而我们学戏的过程并不是非常的浪漫。

translation: It is hard.
transcript: 学戏是一个非常痛苦的过程。

translation: How hard?
transcript: 多少痛苦？

translation: You may go watch the movie Farewell My Concubine by Director Chen Kaige.
transcript: 大家可以去看陈凯歌先生的《霸王别姬》这个电影，

translation: Although it is set in the dark days, the experience of us actors is the same.
transcript: 虽然那是万恶的旧社会，但是其实作为一个学戏的演员来讲，我们所经历的所有的过程都一样。

translation: But because of the painful experience, I have the chance to dream.
transcript: 但是正是因为有了这一些积累，才让我有做梦的机会。

translation: I started to dream after years of training.
transcript: 而从我寻梦开始的起点来讲。

translation: On October 9, 2002, I got the opportunity to perform, with Japanese Kabuki master Ichikawa Emiya, the story of a Japanese Duliniang and a Chinese Liu Mengmei dreaming  together.
transcript: 那是完成了很多年学习以后，2002年的10月9号，我跟日本歌舞伎的大师市川笑也先生，一起演了一个日本的杜丽娘和中国的柳梦梅在一起做梦的故事。

translation: This is where my dream started, through which I realized that the pursuit of dream could remind us of the past.
transcript: 这是我寻梦的开始，让我发现原来，寻梦，可以让我们发现过去。

translation: We only spent 4 hours on rehearsal.
transcript: 我们这段表演只用了四个小时来排练。

translation: I was genuinely surprised by his exquisite and superb performance for a Japanese version of Du Liniang.
transcript: 我很惊讶于一个日本的杜丽娘可以演绎得这么细腻传神。

translation: I extended my gratitude to Mr. Ichikawa.
transcript: 我向市川笑也先生表示感谢。

translation: He said he was confident that he can act well because, as he put it, China was exactly where they learnt these skills from.
transcript: 嗯，市川笑也先生说我一定可以演得很好，是因为，我们很多东西是从你们那里传来的。

translation: His words enlightened me. Indeed, when you get too familiar with something, you will neglect it.
transcript: 我才发现原来一个东西一个梦想在你身边你太熟悉的时候，你会忽略它。

translation: So when we chase your dream, we will recollect what we have left behind, thus learning to respect and restoring our faith in the future.
transcript: 所以当我们去寻找一个梦想的时候，会让我们发现过去，那份过去是让我们学会尊重，让我们有更多的信心去朝前走得更远。

translation: That was also why I felt so full of strength at the beginning of my pursuit of dream.
transcript: 所以当这个寻梦之旅开始的时候，我觉得，哦原来梦想可以给我这么大的一个力量。

translation: What the pursuit of dream gives me even more is the ability to change the present.
transcript: 寻梦其实也可以给我更多的一种力量是：改变现在。

translation: In 2008 I was very honored to be invited by Mr. Tan Dun to act a special character named Rustichello in his opera Marco Polo.
transcript: 在2008年的时候非常有幸，谭盾先生请我去做他的歌剧《马可波罗》当中一个很特别的一个角色，那这个角色名字叫做Rustichello。

translation: In fact, Rustichello is the author of the book The Travels of Marco Polo.
transcript: Rustichello是《马可波罗东行游记》里面的，真正的这本书的作者。

translation: At the audition, Mr. Tan asked what I was capable of.
transcript: 谭盾先生在面试我的时候，他说：“你会表演一段什么？”。

translation: I said, "I am a Kunqu Opera actor, I can sing Kunqu."
transcript: 我说：“我是昆曲演员，我会演唱昆曲。”

translation: I sang a piece of kunqu.
transcript: 我为他表演了一段昆曲。

translation: Then he asked what else I could perform and my answer was nothing.
transcript: 唱完以后他问我：“还会什么别的？”我说：“我不会了。”

translation: At this moment, the junior schoolmate who went along with me cut in, "He can rap!"
transcript: 陪我一起去的小师妹说：“师哥会Rap！”。

translation: I said, "No, I can't. I did rap when I was young, but I dare not rap before a true musician."
transcript: 我说：“我不敢说Rap，我年轻的时候唱歌跳舞去玩过，但是在音乐大师面前我可不敢Rap。”。

translation: However, Mr. Tan said, "It's fine, Do a rap."
transcript: 但是谭老师说：“没关系，来一段Rap。”

translation: Then I performed a piece of Rap, which was the only one I could think of.
transcript: 我把我脑子里仅有的想得起来的一段Rap我演绎了一下。

translation: Three months laterI received the message that I was chosen.
transcript: 三个月以后我被通知说，你被选中了。

translation: I was confused of why me, yet I was delight for joining such an international cast.
transcript: 我也稀里糊涂，我不知道为什么我被选中，但是很高兴我有机会去参加这样一个国际级的卡司。

translation: We were sent to Amsterdam of the Netherlands to rehearse with distinguished opera singers all over the world who speak English.
transcript: 到了荷兰阿姆斯特丹以后，我们跟世界上一些非常著名的歌唱家一起做排练，全是来自世界各地的讲英文的那一些很棒的歌剧演唱家。

translation: On the first day, when Mr. Tan introduced me to others, he said that Zhang Jun was an inheritor of Kunqu, an art with 600 years of history, and he had learnt a lot of traditional Kunqu plays including bla, bla, bla, which are so distinctive.
transcript: 而那天我们一起排练的时候谭盾介绍大家认识，介绍到我的时候就说张军是中国昆曲的六百年历史的这样的一个艺术的传承者，他学了很多昆曲的传统的戏，有哪些哪些哪些，昆曲是多么的与众不同。

translation: At the end, surprisingly, he asked me to sing a rap song.
transcript: 然后谭盾说给大家来一段Rap。

translation: I was nervous and embarrassed about rapping before classical opera singers.
transcript: 嘶我当时非常紧张我也觉得很难为情，在一些歌剧演唱大师面前居然让我说Rap。

translation: But out of respect, I did what I was told.
transcript: 当然恭敬啊不如从命，还是说了一段Rap。

translation: We had nine performances in Amsterdam, which scored an unprecedented success.
transcript: 这个戏在阿姆斯特丹演出了九场，非常空前，非常成功，

translation: At the celebration in Shanghai, we extended our gratitude to our friends and leaders from the art circles for their support.
transcript: 回到上海以后我们组织了一个庆功会，向上海的艺术界的朋友、领导来表示感谢，因为有他们的支持才让我到那边去做了这样一个戏。

translation: I shared everything of this trip to Amsterdam with them.
transcript: 我把我们一路行程的点点滴滴跟大家一起分享，一起汇报。

translation: Mr. Tan also told plenty of funny stories and expressed his thanks for all the help.
transcript: 谭盾也讲了很多这个过程当中很有趣的事情，感谢大家的帮助。

translation: Then he asked me again to sing a rap song.
transcript: 然后他说了一句话，张军给大家来一段Rap。

translation: I rapped three times.
transcript: 我一共说了三次Rap。

translation: Now I can't recall what did I rap about.  I felt embarrassed.
transcript: 当然我已经想不起来那些Rap说的是什么，我觉得挺难为情的。

translation: However, this time, I finally can't help asking him "Mr. Tan, why did you ask me to rap on such important occasions?"
transcript: 但是在那一次我终于忍不住我问谭盾，我说：“谭老师，为什么在这样三个，对于这个这次行程来讲特别重要的时刻，您让我说Rap呢？”

translation: He replied, "In fact everyone of us is Marco Polo. It is openness.
transcript: 他是这样说的，他说：“其实我们每个人都是马可波罗。

translation: The play is called Marco Polo, but actually everyone of us is Marco Polo, in that we all want to disseminate to the western world the eastern arts, cultures and spirits we hold dear.
transcript: 这出戏叫麦《马可波罗》，但是我们每个人都是马可波罗，我们都想把身边我们觉得美好的东方的艺术、文化、精神，可以传播出去，传播到西方的朋友去身身边去。

translation: Then, what do you think is the most important thing in the process.
transcript: 那在这个传播的过程当中，什么东西最重要呢。

translation: You need an open mind to embrace others' ideas, learn from others and share with others.
transcript: 它叫open，它叫开放；你需要有一颗开放的心，你愿意去拥抱别人，你愿意向别人学习，愿意跟别人一起来互动来分享。”

translation: Only when you open your mind can the others readily accept you.
transcript: 当你敞开胸怀的时候，别人才会来拥抱你。

translation: So Zhang Jun is a Kunqu actor, but he can rap, he's willing to rap.
transcript: 所以，张军是一个昆曲演员，但是他会说Rap，他意愿意去说Rap。

translation: The point I want to make is that we artists are open in mind to embrace the world.
transcript: 我想表明的是，我们这些艺术家，我们有开放的心去拥抱全世界。

translation: This is a spirit we all need most."
transcript: 这是我们最最需要的一种精神。

translation: In thinking deeply about it, I realized that this was a strength dream pursuing could bring us, a strength that broadened our mind so as to change everything at the present.
transcript: 那我想，原来寻梦给我们的力量，是让我们可以有这样的胸怀去改变所有的一切，改变现在。

translation: This is just like the first line of the opera.
transcript: 就像这一出戏的第一句话第一句台词。

translation: Interestingly,it's an opera with an English libretto and Kunqu-style music, all by Tan Dun. The first line goes like this,  "As the book of time space opens, there is music suggesting the Peking Opera. "
transcript: 非常有意思，整个表演都是谭盾设计的昆曲加英文，这句台词叫As the book of time space opens，there is music suggesting the Peking Opera。

translation: Peking Opera represents not only itself, but also Kunqu Opera, or a voice from China.
transcript: Peking Opera不仅仅代表京剧，我觉得也代表昆曲，更代表了一种中国的声音。

translation: We can change the present and enrich our voices.
transcript: 我们可以改变现在，让自己拥有更多中国的声音。

translation: And we perform in a unique way.
transcript: 那这种演绎的方式也是非常独特的。

translation: I believe you must have never heard English words pronounced in this way.
transcript: 我想您一定没有听到过这样的英语的发音。

translation: It is the first time on this stage.
transcript: 在这个舞台上是第一次。

translation: It is also the only one of its kind even in Europe.
transcript: 在欧洲的歌剧舞台上也是绝无仅有的一次。

translation: This is what we are capable of changing when we have gained power from our dream.
transcript: 原来我们可以改变这么多，当你拥有一种追梦的力量的时候。

translation: For me, I am expecting that the power we gain from our dreams will enable us to create the future.
transcript: 我想，追梦寻梦的力量，给我们更多的一种期盼是我们可以，创造未来。

translation: About two months ago, I gave a particularly important performance on this stage.
transcript: 在不久以前差不多两个月前，在这个舞台上，呃，我做了我一个非常重要的一个表演。

translation: Its theme was Kunplug, a new style of Kunqu Opera.
transcript: 叫Kunplug水磨新调的嗯昆曲新音乐的演唱会。

translation: Those songs from hundreds years ago are renewed with electric instruments, they are enriched with imagination .
transcript: 那些四百年五百年六百年前的曲子，插上了电，拥有了一个全新的一个想象力。

translation: I reckon this kind of music to be highly penetrating.
transcript: 我想这样的音乐，是非常非常，具有穿透力。

translation: It reminds me back to the Ming Dynasty, when Du Liniang was dreaming her dreams, when she was singing about the blooms and grass, thinking to live or to die, there was definitly no electricity.
transcript: 我想在明代的时候，杜丽娘在做梦的时候，她在唱那一些花花草草、生生死死的时候，一定没有电。

translation: But the electric means today allow us to trace back to where our dreams started and recover our original aspiration.
transcript: 那我们今天拥有这些电的手段，恰恰其实是让我们回到我们梦想最最开始的地方，让我们一起回到我们曾经做梦的那个源头在哪里。

translation: The name of this music is Jiang Er Shui–All of a Sudden My Heart is Drawn.
transcript: 这段唱腔叫《江儿水·偶然间心似缱》。

translation: Those ways of worship a thousand years ago, those implicit love stories, the most romantic dream Du Liniang had ever dreamed,  remind me that when we make a choice about our dreams, and when we have faith in our inner voices, we can certainly create a completely different future.
transcript: 那些一千多年前的祭菩方式，那些委婉的爱情故事，那个杜丽娘曾经做过的那个最最最最浪漫悠远的梦，让我们知道，我们去选择自己梦想的时候，当我们去相信自己心灵的声音的时候，我们一定可以创造一种全新的未来。
